verbose_text: Our results suggested that cholesterol may increase the intercellular reactive oxygen species (ROS) level and activate the PI3K / AKT signaling pathway, and then increase the Nrf2 expression and promote its separation from the Keap1 - Nrf2 complex, which translocates to the nucleus and binds the promoter of HO-1 and plays an antioxidant role in cardiomyocytes.
